Or maybe you guys are just bitching that he posted it twice, I don't actually know. Either way, his posting it up here clearly made some people happy (20 chubbies?) and it isn't like it's one of manflesh's long ass posts of nonsense, you can easily scroll away if you've already seen it..ya'll need some buddha action up in this bitch.

name: brokebackmark
text:
I had a similar experience to this. I was pokin' around in there because it hurt. and well... it escalated. you see, I had been working a tough summer job and I had to lift stuff often. holdin this stuff across my belly sorta, (not the best way I know) with both hands, I thought I was just pushin it. figgered some dirt or something had gotten in there so i started washin it out in the shower. THIS IS WHERE IT GOT WORSE. it only got more sore. and a fluid started leakin. not bein the kind to flip out, i figgered now that there may be an ingrown hair or something in there so i started washin it with q-tips damp with hydrogen peroxide. few days later the ordeal was done and i am no longer worried. i'm pretty shocked however that this INSANELY rare topic should come up only a few weeks after it happened to me.
perhaps Onstad shared a similar affliction. in which case i am sorry for you my dog.

i am not kidding by the way. all the naysayers be silent because i am not in the mood.

name: meddle
text:
This alt text is a reliable source of Truth. I know it is kind of weak to post the alt text, but every time I see a reference to it low on the page I have to scroll up because I can't remember that shit. With that in mind: "It's a clear fluid, not blood. In a way, that's worse."
On the other hand, this one is kind of memorable.

name: kamet
text:
Theories:

A deeply imbedded pimple in his belly-button area.

A rupturned Hernia.

A second urethra that has... somehow... worked it's way into the belly button, and has gained clearance because of his finger clearing the belly button lint?

name: kamet
text: Rupturned.  That's a fun new word.

name: meddle
text: Sounds pretty painful.

name: kamet
text: Now that I think about it.. if you had a sharp, pointy cat claw, would you really want to go poking around in pseudo-orifices with it?

name: irondave
text: You certainly do not want to go knuckle deep with it.  That was Careless.

name: lechatbotte
text:
I'd say the unexpected twist is back. Honestly never saw that curve coming. (We should be grateful it came well AFTER lunch.) But what comes next? WHAT COMES NEXT?!

One unlikely but fun scenario: He dies and meets that purrfect feline in a low-rent dig in Heaven, and visits Little Nephew to boot. Will he bring him back with him?

name: daidai
text: Puns make me sad :(

name: lechatbotte
text: Not intended to pun-ish you (he purred playfully while consuming a large quiche).

name: zapatos
text: If he dies from this, it could be accidental suicide?  Straight to hell... again.

name: lechatbotte
text: Suicide is all in intent. It can't be "accidental". This would be a tragic (if perhaps mind-boggling) way to check out, but it certainly isn't suicide when he goes down begging for a doctor!

name: zapatos
text: So if you were going to shoot yourself in the brains, but had to go to the bathroom real bad and set the gun down but it went off and blew away your thumb/ kidney/ kneecap and were laying there screaming for help in the middle of Starbucks but blead to death, it wouldn't be suicide?

name: aperson
text: That's legally referred to as 'ignominious suicide'.

name: featurelessvoid
text: or "performance art," in some circles

name: lechatbotte
text:
What was the honest intent? Seriously, if you are for real set on offing yourself, you do it before relieving yourself, because you expect the ultimate relief. Similarly, when you blow out a painful part of the flesh, you bleed to death screaming for someone to give ya' the gun so you can do it proper, not for a doctor. If you're screaming for a doctor, you not really suicidal!

Beyond that, when playing with firearms, one might just have present in mind the possibility of lethal injury being an outcome. I honestly never thought of playing with belly buttons as positing such possibility, nor do I think Ray would have.

name: lechatbotte
text: Further thought, it really doesn't matter how WE judge the thing. It's God's call what is authentic suicide.

name: zapatos
text: Well if God decides, I'm in trouble.

name: werewolves
text: I almost barfed on the ground when I read this. This is a very real fear of mine.

name: deadpool
text:
It should only be scary if you prod your navel often...

So, you do?

name: lechatbotte
text: Not anymore...I just quit - forever!

name: emosexy
text: It is of my sister's.  She once messed with her bellybutton once so much that it bled, but only a little.  She just scratched too much.  And after reading this strip, I about threw up in my mouth.

name: flazisismuss
text: The mysterious clear liquid is worse since you know approximately how much blood you have.  I think I have about nine or ten fifths worth of blood but who know how much clear fluid you have left at any given time?

name: deadpool
text:
You know a very common clear liquid?

Also happens to be a lot of it in a healthy body.

Yep, water.

name: flazisismuss
text: Do people really have little pockets of water around their body?  I think that the H2O we've got is mixed up with other stuff.  If I poked myself and pure water poured out I wouldn't writhe on the floor in pain and fear.  I would stare at it with wonder, and giggle.

name: daidai
text: That's what Jesus, did when this happened.

name: daidai
text: New rule: Jesus, is so cool he gets a free comma after his name.

name: tekende
text: Jesus, is just all right with me...

text:

--Terrence 5:26-28

text:
It's like when Bush Sr. tried to be polite and follow customs and ended up throwing up on the Japanese prime minister.

I'm embarrassed.

name: octafish
text:
* clicks post * Hey where did my witticism go? Oh well I'll try again.

I feel your pain.

name: hardelicious
text: "46. And hardelicious fell before the demons of Assetbar, and was like unto a fool. 47. And the people heaped lames upon hardelicious' head like ashes. 48. And Onstad came from on high and cast hardelicious into the Pit, where Hannah Barbera cartoons were played on an eternal loop, 49. and there was weeping and gnashing of teeth."

name: lechatbotte
text: NO! Not Hannah Barbera! (Dread and trembling.)

name: zaratustra
text:
On average, a person has about 11 litres (2.4 imperial gallons) of interstitial fluid providing the cells of the body with nutrients and a means of waste removal.

So, yeah, he could be leaking there for a long time.

name: lechatbotte
text: The stench, oh the stench of it all!

name: bumpishound
text: Oh that stench!

name: hamscout
text: Merry Maids be damned--they will never get the reek of Ray's belly-bong water out of the carpet.

name: pogo
text: Belly-bong water!

name: preston
text: We've seen a lot of stuff come out of Ray . There are more possibilities, I reckon, but I hope it never comes to that.

name: lucidz
text:
Man but if this ain't a euphemism for every time I've ever met up with an ex....

You ain't seen each other for a spell, out of boredom decide to meet up, for a quick cocktail, natch...

For the briefest of moments, It even seems like that old flame might just still be there.. But at the end of the day, one of you ALWAYS ends up lying on the floor in a pool of navel blood.

name: possums
text: That is basically the most disgusting thing I've ever seen in this comic.

name: kamet
text: You haven't read enough, my friend.

name: davey-boy
text: Worse than a guaranteed honky-tonk style blow job, worse than Beef's prostitute, worse than seeing a dude's stew. I think that covers it. We have a new champion.

name: tommycrashwreck
text: I read the middle row first, after only noticing that the characters were Ray and Tina. I was pretty fucking surprised about this strip's content until I read the first and third rows.

name: lechatbotte
text: I was still surprised.

name: awko
text: I've got to try this whole "reading the comic out of order" thing sometime.

name: stereo
text: The Canadian dialogue can be read in reverse panel order and still make sense. It's neat.

name: stereo
text: Sorry guys, I'm really not sure what this means.  I think I was just making stuff up.

name: echidnaboy
text:
I think you meant this one .

I'M IN UR BRANE TASTIN UR SYNAPSIZ

name: stereo
text: I guess I was, the search on the main page failed to find it even though I searched for both "Canada" and "Canadian".  Apparently it's not transcribed.  At least I'm not losing my mind.

name: d3athcann0n
text:
I used to worry about this exact thing happening.
Now I've come to terms with its inevitability.

name: singtralala
text: hey man not cool i totally got that same avatar, only better trimmed and timed

name: d3athcann0n
text: Then its not the same...but i will change mine anyways

name: halnewcome
text: I think this is going to put me off my feed for a few meals.

name: lavienoir
text:
Beef's rhyme is actually part of a twelve-song epic cycle by Richard Wagner's alcoholic dietician little brother. The rhyme for vodka goes:


The liquor distilled from the grain of wheat

Will leave your midriff slim and neat

But the spirit risen from potato starch

Will set your waistline on the march

name: hamscout
text:
Imbibing many crispy Stellas
soon makes you a paunchy fella.

Gin is thin, but you know it isn't
rad to have alcoholism.

name: usversusthem
text: Well, this provides them at least with a pretty solid "What-Not-to-Do" for the inaugural men's grooming article.

name: lechatbotte
text:
The photos alone might sell more than actually useful directions would. (I'll bet she taking the snapshots RIGHT NOW!! That bitch.)

I just hope that isn't his mojo and gumption draining uselessly away...

name: chilibone
text:
my grandma used to call my belly button my sugar bowl and pretend to eat sugar out of it and tickle me

my grandma did not molest me, despite how this may sound

name: telescreen
text: My grandma called me Speedball. She never gave me speed.

name: woodenteeth
text: Your avatar gives this story some disturbing imagery.

name: pogo
text: Was there a little handle on your sugar bowl that she grabbed?

name: deusoma
text: Soon to be featured on 2cats1navel.com!

name: irondave
text: This series of events is exaggerated only slightly.

name: lightupafatty
text: whoa, i just noticed your avatar. pretty clever reference there, dude. and im pretty confused as to why you made it in the first place.

name: irondave
text: I like quantititive graphics and long walks on the beach.  Also, I see myself as maybe part of the intersection there.

name: zapatos
text: Because it is awesome.

name: deadpool
text:
This is very common in cats. They eventually discover that they had an umbilical cord and they start to mess around with their belly button. If their claw goes too deep they can rupture their stomach and cause the HCl to leak out.

Naw, I'm joking. Cats don't even have belly buttons.

name: lechatbotte
text: So, this is a dream?

name: deadpool
text: Hmm, I doubt it. If the cats can walk and talk, then Onstad has the artistic license to give them umbilici.

name: lechatbotte
text: Yeah. I kinda guessed that. But I still find myself wondering how it is arranged so that cat's don't need umbilici. Maybe if I'd spent more time in the classroom or on the farm, I'd be much wiser on this question. As it is, I display my complete mediocrity.

name: pogo
text: All mammals are placental and have navels.

name: lechatbotte
text: Does this include platypi and marsupials?

name: mrwombat
text: No, marsupials develop a yolk sac during early development, and montremes lay their eggs! Only placental mammals develop placenta and by extension, umbilici, making them less delicious.

name: topsy
text: making which less delicious?  the mammals or the placenta?

name: lechatbotte
text: I will guarantee that the non-existent placenta of non-placental mammals is always less delicious.

name: cdumas
text: Considering he's given the girls only two fat titties, navels seem a pretty minor deviance.

name: meddle
text: Well, I know they're born with umbilical cords...  But I'm not gonna lie, I totally flipped my cat over to check when I saw this strip.  I couldn't find anything at first and then I decided I didn't want to find anything.

name: deadpool
text: Cats normally give birth to several young at one time. You seen 6 cats dangling out of a mama cat from umbilical cords?

name: meddle
text: One of my cats' brothers was born with an umbilical cord wrapped around one of his legs, preventing development.  I saw that.  It was pretty gross.

name: blueloggy
text:
Doesn't the mama cat chew the cord off of the kitten as it comes out? Like, the cat licks away the sac and the cord at the same time? I mean, it is totally gross, but that's nature for you.

Also I bet if you had a hairless cat you could find a tiny belly button on his stomach.

name: blueloggy
text: I haven't posted on here in so long that I forgot my avatar is of a tiny sleeping kitten. I should've posted it in her voice. Like "my mama used her mouth to chew my umbilical cord off after she pushed me out of her tummy!" or something. Gah.

name: kickstart
text: my mother was a saint, you hear me?  A saint!

name: octafish
text: My father stormed the beach at Normandy!

name: tekende
text: MY FATHER ONCE KNEW A MAN!

name: stereo
text: My parents are DEAAAAAAAAAAAAD!

name: daidai
text: Best reference yet today.

name: octafish
text: Really works with the Bale avaricon.

name: falseprophet
text: BIBLICALLY

name: falseprophet
text: WAIT A MINUTE

name: falseprophet
falseprophet
lechatbotte
text: Dude, enough already.

name: daidai
text: Audacious! Tenatious! Apollo, Doth thou burn the candle at both ends?

name: loneal
text: When my dog had puppies, they had tiny little belly buttons visible before they grew their fur. (Also, one of them was green for several weeks because the green sac that his mom chewed off of him was apparently quite potent.) Presumably cats have the same thing. I don't think they can magically transport nutrients into their young just because they give birth in litters. Human triplets all have umbilical cords simultaneously. Look around you: mammals.

name: norrin
text:
When we were little our cat had a litter, and my sister saw what she thought was something impaling one of the kittenns and pulled it out. It was what I beleive was the left over chewed off embilical chord.

The kitty died and we out it in an empty bag of Doritos and buried it.

On an unrelated note, my cousin once went around trying to bash little baby chicks and ducklings with a hammer when he was two.

name: lechatbotte
text: Dude, why you even gotta say a thing?

name: octafish
text: Not Radd Norrin, not Radd at all.

name: seanbad
loneal
text:
My brother and cousin smashed one of our hamsters with a hockey stick when they were two! Maybe cute-animal-smashing is a main thing of two-year-olds! I don't even know how the thing survived. We had to feed it with an eyedropper for weeks because all its teeth were broken.

(See also: The time my sister stepped on the goldfish which had jumped out of its bowl. It floated upside down for a bit, then it turned right side up and promptly lived for two more years.)

name: daidai
text: Is your mom's name Beatrix Kiddo?

name: loneal
text: I have not seen those movies and do not understand this reference. =/

name: davey-boy
text: Lucky.

name: gormster
text: V-lame. Those movies were awesome.

name: zapatos
text: What flavor?  I would hate to be buried in a bag of Cool Ranch.

name: lechatbotte
text: If you find it, please DO NOT PROBE!

name: jaydub
text: Its there. Its a flat, oval shaped thing - not like a human navel. Don't know why.

name: agentj
text: Tina is not a good life(style brand) partner. Her trifling type would ignore your DNR, then leave your vegetative ass by a roadside or suchlike.

name: jaydub
text: Never dug that deep - but belly fuzz does trap some fun lint in mine.

name: bumpishound
text: Ray is like knuckles deep in that dang old bellybutton.

name: stereo
text: I can go at least 1 knuckle deep in mine, but this strip has made me afraid of probing deeper.  There's still some give, but I'm about as afraid of making that phone call as Tina is.

name: morypcaina
text:
elbow deep within the borderline
it may hurt a little but A BLA BLA BLOO BLA BLOO BLOOOOOOO!

name: woodenteeth
text: I have been over-friendly but not even Assetbar can stop me and my V-CHUB POWERS!

name: jorsh
text: AAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: endoftheworld
text: Strip was pretty gross. Then I read the ALT text, and that took things to a new and uncomfortable level.

name: octafish
text: Dr Andretti is going to have a field day with this. I fear this spells the end of the heirloom chicken farm.

name: quaga
text: Maybe that's all the diabetes leaking out. Perhaps this is what it means to almost have diabetes.

name: waddlerz
text: Ray is pregnant!  It's the amneotic fluid that is seeping from his womb/wound!

name: echidnaboy
text: OH GOD MAN THIS IS SO WAAAACKYYYYY

name: gormster
text: Ray is pregnant with Philippe's 5th birthday present.

name: octafish
text: Ray did not need to be yelled at, he instinctively knew that gushing clear liquid from your navel is wrong.

name: biznart
text:
I'm so glad it was Beef that walked in and not Philippe. You're just not ready for these kinds of things at the age of five.

Shit, I don't think I'm ready for it at the age of 29.

name: jhaela
text: I don't think Philippe has been ready for half the things he's seen.

name: quaga
text: I don't think I ever want to be ready to see that

name: chloraloner
text: This...just...ruuuuude.

name: snickers
text: Oh man you need to do a parody of that Scott McCloud Google Chrome comic. Ray and Beef heads floating around the page, going all meta on Eggs and Milk Minder features. Beef all like paragraphs of lowercase stream of consciousness and Ray like "It's muliti-process, biotch!"

name: mystkmanat
text: What is Tina wearing???

name: irondave
text: I say it's vest over a blouse with some kind of detailing on the front.  Pleats, or possibly ruffles of some sort.  Disclaimer:  I am not an expert on Fashion.

name: kamet
text: I believe it is Onstad's attempt to create a cowl-necked blouse of sorts, underneath Tina's suit vest.

name: skoora
text:
SCRUT
SCRUT
SCRUT
SCRUT
SCRUT
SCRUT

Those are the sounds of my nightmares.

name: daidai
text:
Before this comic, this onomatopoeia created images in my head of fat people in wool sweaters trying to squeeze through an unusually small sandpaper-coated hallway.

I never thought I would miss that.

name: massialot
text: Well that harmonious coupling sure didn't last long.

name: zapatos
text: Who says its over?

name: butta
text: Eww eww eww eww eww

name: bumpishound
text: Ray's GOF cred takes a major hit here.

name: lechatbotte
text: Yeah. Good thing none of 'em boys itched his belly button. He'd been done before the start!

name: desert_donkey
text:
damn is nasty. and tina is stupid nasty bitch. she reminds me of those freaky women in "Blue Velvet". the ones that were over at the dude's house who sang that clown song.

as for spontaneous fluids. i just had some surgery on my face. on my nose too. and sometimes fluid (prolly plasma) just starts streaming out of it. it's freaky. justs kinda burst down the face. blood in it too. it's fucking gross.

name: bumpishound
text: Pix pls.

name: lechatbotte
text: NO! Don't do it!

name: octafish
text:
Ben sang a Roy Orbison song.

...do I amuse you? Am I a clown? Is my existence solely for your pleasure?

name: woodenteeth
text: Wow. They took out the lenses for this shot of Roy. I cannot see any reflection whatsoever.

name: farqussus
text: Even at the age of twenty, Roy appeared to be sixty-five years old. Could be a young Karl Malden.

name: nice-on-water
text: Oh Jesus, the call-back to the "HE GETS THINGS DONE" strip is just ACE.

name: catgrl131
text:
Fuck. It's my first day of high school ever tomorrow.

If I don't come back, tell hedonismbot he can have my hair.

name: loneal
text: Fuck. It's my first day of feeling old ever today. I haven't even turned 21 yet, catgrl, don't do this to me, not now, not like this.

name: octafish
text:
Loneal you make me feel old today. I haven't even turned 34 yet. Jeesus.

[i]Your turn Pogo{/i]

name: pogo
text: Old?  You don't know the meaning of old!

name: awko
text: I had my first "old" moment the other day when a lady in the supermarket told her child to stop throwing a tantrum or "that man over there will get mad".

name: woodenteeth
text:
Oh maaan chubby for bringing up that memory. It's a special day. Wait til you start counting up all the ubiquitous technological advances that have come up since you were a teenager. I call mobile phones, PCs, Internet and touch dial phones.

My jokes about hard nipples dialing a phone are redundant .

name: zapatos
text: Those children never make me mad, the mothers do.  Because they never call me back.

name: stereo
text: I have yet to be called "Mister" but I anticipate that day.

name: talix18
text: The first "Ma'am" is the worst.

name: stereo
text: In her defense she was jogging and probably couldn't see very well anyway (yes, I got my first ma'am at age 18)

name: lechatbotte
text: I first got "ma'am"-ed when I was 27. I'm a dude with a beard, so it was kinda esoteric.

name: echidnaboy
text:
Once, when I was 20 or so, a little boy asked his father if I was "a man or a lady" (I think he was confused by the long hair combined with the beard*). I was actually quite pleased he thought I was an adult.

*Or maybe it was the dress HAR HAR

name: hedonismbot
text:
My wife and I ran into one of my coworkers at a grocery store. He was with his 14 year old daughter. We waved, said hello, moved on. I found out that a few seconds later she asked who I was. He told her I was a coworker. She asked him why I was taking my daughter to the store, wasn't she too old for that?

My wife was 24, I was 25. My wife was insulted that someone thought she was 18 or 19. The girl thought I was 45.

name: aperson
text:
It's because of that colostomy bag bulge.

Wait a minute...

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Hi, Dick About Terms here...

Is esoteric the right word here? Just wondering if I'm missing something.

name: thorfinn
text: He might want to keep it a secret, you never know.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Yeah, I thought maybe the person who called him ma'am was a friend and it was an inside joke...?

It all reminds me of Bob Odenkirk's guest spot on NewsRadio, when he keeps using the word "sagacious" incorrectly (in several ways).

name: lechatbotte
text: In that I was not among those choosen to understand it, it struck me that way. What did you think I was trying to say?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I was expecting a word more like "confusing" or "befuddling" to end that sentence. Your anecdote was very short, and without any kind of background it's hard for me to understand why the person calling you "ma'am" would've done so and meant for you not to understand.

I thought you saying "I got called ma'am by someone by mistake which is weird b/c I'm a dude with a beard."

I present a re-wording:

I first got "ma'am"-ed when I was 27. I'm a dude with a beard, so I can only guess that the reasons of the person calling me that were kinda esoteric.

No, even that doesn't sound right. Damn, now got me being the John Holmes of Term-dickage. This is all totally sagacious.

name: lechatbotte
text:
Yes. Most sagacious.

Seriously, not intending to write a novel, I thought the most efficient way to express the way it left me feeling was "kinda esoteric". Not really authentically esoteric, as in "there is a secret society possessing knowledge I lack and which explains my sense of being out of the equation here." Just "kinda" esoteric, like in "I'm the only one not choosen to understand what is going on here."

So, I'm pretty much an efficiency failure, as I complete the sixth more-or-less lengthy comment on this unexpected use of a single word.

(Ever read "The Rule of Four"? I've never read a book so full of unexpected terminations to sentances. It was sometimes quite annoying. Since it's about a code hidden in the odd usage of words in an ancient esoteric work, I've often wondered if these unexpected turns of phrase were intended to conceal a secret messege of some sort, but have no time to seek the solution. Besides, since reading "Foulcault's Pendulum", I'm not much for secrets.)

name: zapatos
text: These things happen.  Frequently it seems... I may just be a pretty lady.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Is it really that bad?

I used to work in retail, and I'd occasionally call girls in their early 20's "ma'am" if I thought it suited the situation; the situation being one where I'm supposed to politely address an adult woman (be they 20 or 60 years old) who's name I don't know.

What should I call them?

Miss? Sorry, miss seems like it's more for 16 or under, I suppose.

Madamoiselle? Only if I'm kissing your hand and bowing at the same time.

M'lady? I'm sorry, I don't swordfight on weekends or eat turkey off the bone.

Really, though, is there a better option I'm just forgetting? It was fun to call the hot, sorority-looking girls "ma'am," though, and see them get a little ticked off. I wonder how many Ma'am Cherries I popped? I address the ladies and from the beginning they do not like me.

name: talix18
text:
For me, clearly it was that bad. But I'm losing my shit over turning 40 this year; perhaps I'm not the best judge.

I guess I just prefer "Miss".

name: loneal
text: I prefer "ma'am" to "miss," which strikes me as a bit condescending. But I am still at the age where I want to look older than I am. My views might change in a few years.

name: hedonismbot
text: My rule is that if you look too young to be my mother, you are a Miss.  Otherwise it's a Ma'am.  Talix would clearly be a Miss.  Loneal would just be referred to using a crude wolf-whistle.

name: topsy
text:
wikipedia has this to say about that.

also, what's a wolf-whistle sound like?

name: loneal
text: Oh you know um it kinda sounds like fweee- fwee yooo or something along those lines.

name: lechatbotte
text: Nice onomatopoeia!

name: zapatos
text: Droopy Dog's 'arch nemesis'.  Loneal does a good job showing us how it's done, she must have experience.

name: talix18
text: I was also thinking that it might have something to do with the age of the person addressing me.  Someone younger than me can call me "ma'am"; someone older than me can call me "miss".  Wolf-whistle reception depends on my mood and there's no predictin' that mess.

name: hedonismbot
text: Oh you'd accept my wolf-whistlin.  I'm a master.  I make a woman feel like the center of the universe with my whistlin.  I can even do it without using my lips.

name: octafish
text:
Ms, down here we pronounce this Mizzz as opposed to Miss.

I also like to use the word lady if the person is giving me the irrits. Listen lady, if you don't stop waving that catalogue in my face I'm calling security.

name: deusoma
text: I don't think it was my first "old" moment, but the other day I saw some elementary school boys with stupidly long hair and I thought the words "(imaginary sigh), Kids today." to myself. Then I was hit by the realization so hard I stopped in my tracks and laughed out loud. I'm pretty sure people on my street now think I'm crazy.

name: bumpishound
text: It is the toughest day when you realize you are the [i]crazy old guy on the street[i/].

name: bumpishound
text: aw man

name: talix18
text: Or just a couple of cats short of "the crazy cat lady"

name: lechatbotte
text:
Isn't that cute? I'm old enough to have a son whose first day of high school was today - and he ain't even my oldest!

Still love the avatar!

name: omni
text: Comment left by omni ignored.

name: catgrl131
text: ...A lot like any other world, but with more atmosphere?

name: topsy
zapatos
text: I was forteen once, it was alright.

name: rowboat
text:
You have used up your lame allotment. Do something nice for a change.

I have seen this message no fewer than twenty times in the last five minutes.

I feel handcuffed.

name: zapatos
text: Maybe you are handcuffed, you should double check.  Just in case.

name: pogo
text: I tried to lame you, just for the heck of it, and got the same message.

name: lechatbotte
text: My lames work. (And you got lamed only in the service of science. I actually appreciate you bringing to my attention the possibility of being too lame to lame.)

name: mystkmanat
text:
I'm a junior in high school, so I can tell a quick anecdote of my first day with the empathy of someone whose pain is still fresh.

The first period of the day was this advanced math class I had tested into. I'm this tiny, nerdy, little 14 year old freshman standing at the back of the room, and when we get our seat assignments, I see I'm next to a huge football-playing junior who's taking the class for the second time. We sit down, and I take out a piece of paper and a pencil and wait patiently for the teacher to start the pop quiz, which I had scared myself into believing we would have. My pencil rolls off my desk, and I lean to pick it back up. But here's the problem: I have short, t-rex style arms and couldn't reach it. I was leaning so far, however, that I did succeed in tipping the desk over and falling onto the giant football player. AND, because I was sitting in the front row, everyone saw me do it.

Best. Day. Ever.

name: woodenteeth
text: A chubby in sympathy.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Which I guess is also something you don't want on your first day at juniour high.

That's right bitches, juniour has a "u" round these parts.

name: woodenteeth
text: wait a minute... no it doesn't.

name: woodenteeth
text: you're an idiot 'teeth

name: lechatbotte
text: If I remember Junior High correctly, it is pretty much the black hole of human experience. High School was sooo much better. Never worry, catgrrl - once you hit your stride, it is a happier place than where you've been.

name: woodenteeth
text:
I think you've replied to the wrong person. Although... a few dollars waved my way.

What? What!?

name: lechatbotte
text: Yeah, that happens. Who's your daddy?

name: fuyukodachi
text: When I was a freshman, I fell out of my desk while trying to convince my geography teacher that penguins do, in fact, inhabit the Galapagos Islands, among other places.  He was insisting that penguins do not live anywhere but Antarctica.

name: woodenteeth
text:
More than likely, that teacher was convinced he was a penguin and you were all living in Antartica. He takes his hallucinations very seriously. I'm suprised at the number of teachers with crippling psychological problems.

That, or he was misinformed.

name: bixschmix
text:
When I was a freshman, I once fell up the bus steps. I landed with my head in the aisle, every eye in the bus turned my way.

So I guess what I'm trying to say is I promise things get better!

name: finish_him
text: Does this have something to do with why your avatar has recently changed from a small child to an evil woman with eyes of murder?  Those eyes are appropriate for public high school.

name: catgrl131
text: Errr, well, my old avicon was me, but then I decided that I wanted to replace my handfacepic, and someone suggested this one, and the rest is history.

name: lechatbotte
text: That was you? You're absolutely gorgeous!

name: catgrl131
text: Aw shucks, mister. *blush, grin, downward glance and leg twist*

name: pogo
text: Keep your legs well twisted, young lady.

name: pogo
text: No hitting on schoolgirls!  That's my job.

name: lechatbotte
text:
Just callin' it like I see it!

(BTW, how much does that job pay?)

name: lechatbotte
text: Thought so.

name: finish_him
text: I thought that was tekende's job.  It occurred to me I may have just caused some tekende-class unintentional creepiness.  I think I'm just gonna go back to being a lurker.

name: tekende
text: No, my job description is limited to hitting on girls who are, you know, of a legal age.

name: finish_him
text: You've altered the eyes.  That, or it's the new video card I installed today.  Either way, less murder - but still pretty evil.

name: doc_rostov
text:
You'll be fine. On my first day of high school, I managed to trip face-first into a trash can. The best part was that nobody noticed, because everyone was looking at the cheerleaders walking in for lunch. The second best part was that the bag had just been changed, so it was empty. Granted, I managed to accidentally do it again before the year was out, and they noticed that time, but my reputation still had at least a few days of blissful neutrality.

It's silly to say "don't worry", so only worry as much as you have to.

name: qingofchina
text: Imagine the whole strip with no dialogue.

name: aplomb
text: we be scruttin

name: octafish
text: mad scrutty

name: bpmead
text: Anyone else imagine Tina with a Rosie Perez-style Puerto Rican accent?

name: deusoma
text: I never really thought about it before, but yeah, that sort of automatically happens whenever she opens her mouth.

name: historyandmetal
text: the previous strip left me feeling strange -- like i had walked into a rehearsal for an achewood bit that was eventually going to get cut.  but this strip has paid it off w/ Tina's digs of "fat boy" and "stupid nerd."  Ray's punctured b-button has punctured the weird tension of his relationship w/ Tina, letting all the held back hostility hiss out into the room.

name: woodenteeth
text: Nice. You see, normally it would take half-an-assetbar to relate those sentiments. Chub for you.

name: rumblefish
text:
Wait...'SOON.'..?
How long has Tina been watching Ray slowly crumble to the floor leaking (possibly) vital fluid??

name: trealnaaqed
text:
i squirm in my seat when reading this comic. i'm not touching my belly button ever again.

aw man dogg, that is not something i want to see, that is not something i want to see at all.

name: unclesma
text:
Man, Ray, you cannot die, dog.
We have seen enough of Hell.

name: ashoykh
text: [in the end?] we find out that ray is not actually fat.  In preparation for hibernation, he stores Mezcal in his subcutaneous fat layers.

name: ashoykh
text: the other possibility is that ray has DSB. (Dangerous Semen Backup)

name: peterjoel
text: Ray has this.

name: steev_dayv
text: I don't think he has gotten any since his run-in with that chicken hooker and it's mixed-race bastard child.

name: tekende
text:
My grandfather used to tell my mother's cousin that if she played with her belly button, her bottom would fall off. My mother's cousin, being a young girl at the time, believed him, and from then on would not let her mother clean her belly button in the bathtub. Eventually her mother decided it was time for this to stop and told my grandfather to tell the girl that playing with her belly button would not, in fact, cause her bottom to fall off.

So he said to the girl, "Come here, I have to tell you something," and then paused. "Remember, if you play with your belly button, your bottom will fall off."

name: awko
text:
My aunt used to warn us that if we picked our noses, we'd catch our fingernail on a hook and our eyes would fall out. After deliberating this for some time, we elected one cousin to take one for the team and go for the hook.

His eyes didn't pop out.

He was relieved, we were disappointed.

name: lechatbotte
text:
I remember being told that earwigs like to crawl into your ears and make you deaf. It was many years before I overcame a debilitating, unreasonable fear of the little suckers!

Ah, the lies we tell in jest, might prove far worst then the rest!

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i can identify with this comic pretty well. i have bled out of my belly button from too much spelunking.

it's amazing to me that the fluid is coming out at such high pressure.

name: tekende
text: This is somewhere on the list of things I didn't want to know about anyone, ever.

name: lechatbotte
text: Having met the perfect date, and enjoying the time of his life with her, when tekende learned of the day she oozed clear fluid from her perfect mid-rift, he laughed politely, even while knowing in the depths of his heart that no matter how mad-rutty this evening ended, it was so over for him. There was no solace, and he died a little inside that day.

name: topsy
text: there should really be a wikipedia article on this.  Wikipedia has so come a long ways, but still has so far to go.

name: bixschmix
text: There is a lot of good information there but man those editors can be assholes.

name: lechatbotte
text: Citation needed.

name: bixschmix
text: TOPIC DOES NOT MEET NOTABILITY REQUIREMENTS; RECOMMEND FOR SPEEDY DELETION

name: autrepoupee
text:
Where did the blood come from though

Do you have really sharp fingernails? Were you using a knife? Or perhaps a seafood fork?

name: steev_dayv
text: This is entirely unrelated to the strip and will probably be overlooked what with it's appearance so far down on the page BUUUUUUT...isn't Roast Beef essentially part robot what with all his pseudo deaths and robotic organs?  I'd like to see a call-back to those strips.

name: rodjmeister
text: clear fluid is far worse than blood...but I think blood would be mixed in.

name: featurelessvoid
text:
It's our fault, you know. In the days before Assetbar, the previous strip would have bloomed into a fine story arc. But with the long weekend, Chris Onstad had plenty of time to read the comments and learn of our collective dislike for Tina. Burdened with this knowledge, he euthanized the nascent arc today.

Try though we might, dear Assetbards, we cannot escape the horrible truth: the arc is dead, and the blood is on our hands. Well, not blood, exactly, but some sort of clear fluid.

name: woodenteeth
text: ... or Tina performs some kind of guilty vigil and slowly roasts all of Ray's friends hence alienating him from deleted due to copywrite purposes.

name: johnmatrix
text: Onstad don't read the comments. He's said he doesn't want to be influenced by them.

name: woodenteeth
text: and yet every now and then he comments on them...

name: zapatos
text: Who is he?

name: sje46
text:
onstad.
He is. . . Onstad.

text: Onstad's handle is onstad?  I saw no posts on that handle's account.

name: sje46
text:
He only posted like 9 times, if that.
It is onstad, though. The avatar is the same as the cover of the Achewood Cookbook.
He commented a few strips back. Let me find it.

name: ohdangit

name: gladi8orrex
text: dis effin' comic effin nasty. fuck . still fibed tho 4 shok valoo. jesus

name: featurelessvoid
text:
Quote:
dis effin' comic effin nasty. fuck. still fibed tho 4 shok valoo. jesus


Translation:
This elfin comic effects a nastiness. Fact! Styling fibers, though, a shocking velour. je ne sais quoi

Here we see gladi8orrex embracing abstraction. Bored with the current Achewood strip, he switches his attention to some unknown comic about elves. Said comic is quite offensive, but as is his mission, Glad finds something positive in it: textiles so stylish that they almost redeem the whole affair.

Thank you, gladi8orrex, for helping us all remember to look for that silver lining inside the grey cloud of the webcomics world.

name: evolume
text: holy shit 5 for "scrut scrut" alone.

name: null
text: This is a hard strip to read while eating pizza rolls.

name: irondave
text: The squish when you bite them made you uncomfortable, didn't it?

name: woodenteeth
text: maybe it was the liquid that jetted into his mouth, hot and viscous .

name: c_dizzle
text: though, your eating pizza rolls immediately reminded me of Dr. Orpheus...so...at least that's one momentary diversion on the way to wretching.

name: tekende
text: Do not be hasty in entering that room! I had Taco Belllll for lunch!!

name: thorfinn
text:
I usually try not to be a dick about terms, but:

wretch (n): a miserable person
retch (v): vomit

not the same

name: lechatbotte
text: Thus: The poor wretch has retched on his ratcheted wrenches. The wretch will never get the retching out of the ratchets of his wrenches. Poor wretch.

name: atmus
text: Wretching is like Fishing, only with Wretches.  Pizza Rolls are a good, balanced snackfood for both Fishing and Wretching.

name: zapatos
text: Lie Bot, what is the saddest thing ever?

name: steev_dayv
text: Genocide.

name: thorfinn
text: That would depend on the target of the genocide.  I think most people would agree that tweaker genocide would not be all that sad, and there are many other groups of people that this sentiment would apply to as well.

name: hedonismbot
text: I grin and giggle at the idea of a furry genocide.

name: paperboy_2000
text: All making the ones in the dog costumes dig the mass graves by hand.  All hunched over shoveling dirt between their legs.

name: irondave
text: I feel shame that I laughed out loud at the idea of mass executions of people who think they are animals.

name: tekende
text: In trying to keep my laughter at this comment silent, a very odd noise squeezed betwixt my vocal cords.

name: zapatos
text: I was thinking something more along the lines of, "A young man finds his lost love, they begin to realize their mistake, then he removes his entrails while trying to groom hisself.  Instead of trying to save her love, the woman upsets a nation."

name: mrchee
text: meh

name: paradigmeyes
text:
One can only hope that this is not autobiographical.

Dear sweet sexy jesus.

name: hcaz
text: this is grosser than that time I killed someone.

name: c_dizzle
text: in many ways, onstad...in many ways.

name: thedrizzle
text: Your belly button's so gross, when you cleaned it hot, clear fluid came out! Some of it got on the mayor!

name: girdag
text: Shoulda asked WikiHow

name: rumblefish
text:
Ok...so Ray has a metaphorical belly button.
Panels 4-7 describe the initial stages of his renewed relationship with Tina through to the inevitable time when it all goes south. The clear liquid is either Ray's common sense, or his self-esteem, or the time wasted on Tina, or possibly pus...it might be an infected metaphorical belly button.

name: zapatos
text: I need to grow my beard out like that guy, i already have the dishevled fauxhawk.

name: llobstrosity
text: Gaah, he was almost up to the first knuckle!

name: numberkillinger
text:
I have a question about what the deal is with alt-text in the GOF hardcover and the other printed volumes.

What is the deal with alt-text in the GOF hardcover and the other printed volumes?

name: aperson
text: You can read it but only if you install the firefox plugin.

name: tekende
text: It is not there, but the GOF book has lots of supplemental information and a few extra comic pages here and there. It's well worth the money.

text:
I like to think that by the time he is collapsed, the clear liquor is issuing from Ray with a rhythmic sqt sqt sqt .

sqt sqt sqt .

name: lechatbotte

name: hedonismbot
text: I'll give you three guesses as to what I just found an alarming amount of caked in my belly button. Hell, I'm kinda surprised no dudes have mentioned it yet. Has nobody else plunged a small stick into the belly button afterwards to make a little popsicle?

name: echidnaboy
text: I generally aim it away from my body but then I'm not as hedonistic as you are

name: hedonismbot
text: But then you need to clean it off whatever it hits.  Unless it is a lady.  Then it is their problem.  Same deal if you hit a homeless person with it.

name: aperson
text: My guess: is it mustard?

name: zapatos
text: Only if his member is alike to a bottle of French's

name: roscohoworiginal
text: This is the first achewood strip I actively hate.

name: thorfinn
text: As opposed to passive hatred?

name: roscohoworiginal
text:
Most I passively liked, some, like 9-3-08, I actively liked. One or two I did passively hate. One is a vague malaise, a feeling of I am no more entertained then I was before reading this. The other is the feeling you get when you see a clawed finger digging through a belly button and piercing an artery.

It's when, the next day, you want to check and see if the site updated, but you are afraid you'll see it again, so you minimize the window so that you can confirm the date before proceeding.

name: fictions
text: Dang man I can't get off to this

name: pixie_meat
text: I see Onstad has been reading my nightmare journal again.

name: aaron_haynes
text: It wasn't in there for me, but it hell of is now.

name: goro
text:
Here's my umbilical story.

I was inspired by this strip to start poking around in there. Nothing happened at first, I just kinda noticed some hair deep inside, and that lit my curiosity, since I'm not that hairy a dude.
Then one day I was poking and this... small piece of flesh came out. It was like a tube with a few hairs on one end, which was completely dried up, and then the other end actually resembled real flesh.

Yes, that is nasty.

name: dasilodavi
text:
These past few strips I hadn't rated, though I distinctly remember viewing them.

Perhaps it was because, like now, I just don't know how I feel about them.

name: atypicaloracle
text: Oh God this is my nightmare, this is my bete noire in comic form, the navel is the freakiest of all physical features oh God he is bleeding from his belly hole auugh

text: even though tina is a cat, she is also a dumb heifer.
